name: Citalopram

dosing.adult_acute: 20 mg once daily, may increase after 1 week
dosing.notes: Max 40 mg/day due to QTc prolongation; max 20 mg/day in elderly >60 years; take in morning or evening

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase to 40 mg after 1 week if tolerated
canadian_clinical.max_dose_evidence: 40 mg/day (FDA max due to QTc concerns)
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 40 mg/day; 20 mg/day if >60 years or CYP2C19 poor metabolizers
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 20 mg; can increase to 40 mg after 1 week; monitor ECG if cardiac risk factors
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 10-20 mg; increase to 40 mg after 1-2 weeks; obtain baseline ECG if indicated

warnings: Black box warning: Increased suicidal thinking in children/adolescents/young adults
QTc prolongation - FDA max dose 40 mg/day (20 mg if >60 years, poor CYP2C19 metabolizers, or hepatic impairment)
ECG monitoring recommended at higher doses or with cardiac risk factors
Generally well-tolerated with fewer drug interactions than other SSRIs

cautions.renal: No adjustment for mild-moderate impairment; use caution in severe
cautions.pregnancy: Pregnancy Category C; consider escitalopram as alternative
